image.altText: A collage graphic of an anonymous man walking. On his left are Moscow buildings and a soviet flag. On his right a Sydney skyline

items.synopsis: The untold spy story of a mole in ASIO's ranks who sold the Soviets highly classified intelligence and got away with it.

title.children: The name of the 'traitor' who sold Australia's secrets to the Russians revealed

image.altText: Marnus Labuschagne jumps and turns away as Harry Brook completes a sweep shot

items.synopsis: England's batters look to take the game away from Australia with a stunning attack on the morning of day four at Edgbaston. Follow live.

title.children: England lights up Edgbaston with attacking batting on day four

liveBlogPostPrepared.title: JOE ROOT IS STUMPED! MASTERFUL BY ALEX CAREY!

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: That's a stunning delivery from Pat Cummins! A perfect inswinging yorker. Well, he's not bowled perfectly so far this morning, but that was as close to a perfect delivery as you're likely to see - amazing ball from the Australian skipper. He goes for 13 off 16 balls.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: BOWLED HIM! POPE GOES!

children.content: That's a stunning delivery from Pat Cummins!
Well, he's not bowled perfectly so far this morning, but that was as close to a perfect delivery as you're likely to see - amazing ball from the Australian skipper.

image.altText: Albanese stands speaking to media from a courtyard.

items.synopsis: The federal government has suffered its first major defeat in the Senate, with the Greens and Coalition uniting to reject Labor's centrepiece housing policy.

title.children: Federal government a step closer to early election trigger as Senate rejects housing bill

image.altText: An Aboriginal flag in the foreground, Parliament House in the background

items.synopsis: The Senate votes in favour of the Voice to Parliament legislation, finalising the form of the referendum.

title.children: Referendum legislation passes parliament, putting Australia on track for Voice vote

image.altText: Broome Courthouse

items.synopsis: Tamara Lorimer is charged with unlawfully killing her partner Doreen Lindsay, who died after being run over by a reversing ute.

title.children: Defence lawyer labels Broome woman's driveway death a tragedy as manslaughter trial begins

image.altText: A hundred people gathering next to a paddock and listing to a man speak who is standing on a ute.

items.synopsis: Albermale's 500-person facility was given the green light by state planning authorities, but remained fiercely opposed by Binningup residents.

title.children: US lithium giant abolishes plans for workers' camp in WA coastal town following backlash

image.altText: Clear ocean water and a beach with Busselton jetty in the background.

items.synopsis: The South West of WA is one of the most popular destinations in the state, but locals say tourists are prioritised over residents.

title.children: Holiday homes increase in Busselton by 20 per cent in middle of housing crisis

image.altText: A Ukrainian soldier covers his ears as he fires a mortar at Russian positions next to a burnt out car.

items.synopsis: British military officials say both Russia and Ukraine are suffering high numbers of casualties as Kyiv fights to dislodge the Kremlin's forces from occupied areas.

title.children: Ukraine, Russia suffering heavy casualties during Kyiv's counteroffensive, UK assessment says

image.altText: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken shakes hands with Chinese President Xi Jinping

items.synopsis: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken meets with Chinese President Xi Jinping as he wrapped up a two-day high stakes visit to Beijing.

title.children: Antony Blinken meets Chinese President Xi in bid to ease soaring US-China tensions

image.altText: A woman smiling with two kids.

items.synopsis: Millions of middle-income families who believe they should be working towards a more comfortable life, are instead increasingly feeling the pinch.

title.children: The D'souzas tried out a financial adviser's best tips for saving money. Here's what they learned

image.altText: A donut with pink icing, leaned up against another donut with two big mac burgers behind it.

items.synopsis: Junk food advertising aimed at children could be banned in a bid to tackle child obesity under a bill introduced to the federal parliament.

title.children: 'Self-regulation not working': New law seeks to regulate junk food advertising aimed at children

image.altText: Kitchen Hut, Cradle Mountain, Tasmania.

items.synopsis: An injured Victorian bushwalker survives a night in the freezing Tasmanian wilderness sheltering in a 113-year-old hut near the Overland Track, as authorities urge adventurers to reconsider travel in the area.

title.children: Injured Victorian bushwalker rescued on Tasmania's Overland Track

image.altText: Aleh Sidorchyk smokes a cigarette as he walks out of the Adelaide city police watch house.

items.synopsis: Belarusian actor Aleh Sidorchyk is fined $750 but has avoided jail, after he inappropriately touched a female passenger several times on a Malaysia Airlines flight to Australia in February ahead of this year's Adelaide Festival.

title.children: Actor who indecently touched female passenger on flight to Australia fined $750 but not jailed

image.altText: Children at beach swimming lesson

items.synopsis: Parents say ocean swimming is crucial to water safety in Western Australia and are angry that beach lessons have been cancelled due to safety risks such as gravel roads, poor mobile reception, and fish guts in the water.

title.children: Ocean swimming lessons ban, citing 'irrelevant' risks, could leave kids high and dry

image.altText: A man and woman with hard hats and high vis shirts.

items.synopsis: Sharon Westerman lost her son in a mine incident seven years ago. Each time a person dies on a Western Australian work site she is transported back to that horrific day.

title.children: Renewed calls for improved workplace safety as resources industry grapples with spate of deaths

image.altText: sign  for hospital with building in background in remote Cape York community

items.synopsis: A community wants answers after a toddler died in hospital following several presentations, as local mayors demand better health services from the premier.

title.children: Community demands answers after toddler death at Bamaga Hospital

image.altText: Close-up shot of Scales of Justice statue in Brisbane CBD on August 1, 2018.

items.synopsis: The court heard Woorabinda man Edward Brian Oakley entered a stranger's house through an unlocked door last year before walking into the bedroom of a 13-year-old girl and stroking her leg.

title.children: Man sentenced for entering teen's bedroom, stroking her leg while she slept

image.altText: A prison fence and security camera

items.synopsis: The identities of a man allegedly murdered in Adelaide's high-security Yatala Labour Prison, and the inmate charged over the crime, have been revealed in court.

title.children: Prisoner charged with Yatala cellmate's murder to seek bail, court told

image.altText: Three people with a greyhound on a track.

items.synopsis: Three South Australian greyhound trainers found to have been involved in live baiting are handed life bans from the industry, as well as fined a total of $180,000.

title.children: Life bans, 'largest fines ever' for SA greyhound trainer trio involved in live baiting

image.altText: Four Aberglasslyn Ants rugby league jerseys, each bearing a number eight, lie on the grass.

items.synopsis: A rugby league player from the NSW Hunter Valley has died after a tackle during a game at Port Stephens on the weekend.

title.children: 'Kindest soul': NSW rugby league player dies after on-field tackle

image.altText: An animated crowd of protesters, many wearing red and white, hold posters, pictures and a speaker up as they demonstrate.

items.synopsis: Members of the Association of Southeast Nations (ASEAN) are declining Thailand's invitation to discuss a proposal to "fully engage Myanmar at the leaders' level" despite the country being banned from the association since the 2021 coup.

title.children: Thailand's meeting with Myanmar junta is 'damaging ASEAN's centrality'

image.altText: A cloud of smoke rises in Jenin, the Israeli-occupied West Bank.

items.synopsis: The Israeli military said it launched the raid in Jenin to detain Palestinians suspected of carrying out attacks.

title.children: Three Palestinians killed in fierce clash with Israeli troops in the occupied West Bank

image.altText: Police and ambulance vehicles gather in Bray Park

items.synopsis: A Bray Park man is taken to hospital after allegedly being shot by police responding to a "domestic violence incident".

title.children: Man in critical condition after being shot by police north of Brisbane

image.altText: young man with short hair sits on couch whilst patting dog on his chest

items.synopsis: The 20-year-old bottle shop worker was stabbed to death in March, triggering a bail review. Three months later, the NT government says it will release it to the community.

title.children: Chief minister promises to release bail review, months after Declan Laverty's fatal stabbing

image.altText: Woman in scrubs sits smiling with dog

items.synopsis: During the height of the pandemic, Lisa was working as a nurse in the COVID outbreak squad. She had to leave the unit due to incontinence. Lisa is one of 5 million Australians suffering incontinence.

title.children: The nurse in the COVID outbreak unit who had to resign after wetting herself in PPE

image.altText: A man stands next to a car which came to rest on top of graves.

items.synopsis: A deadly cyclone tears through southern Brazil, forcing thousands from their homes.

title.children: Cyclone leaves 13 dead, three missing in Brazil as record rain floods streets

image.altText: A man reads from paper in front of micrphones with two women either side of him.

items.synopsis: The football club that lost five of its members in last week's Hunter Valley bus crash has spoken publicly for the first time since the tragedy.

title.children: Singleton Roosters speak of 'unfathomable heartache' a week on after fatal Hunter Valley bus crash

image.altText: An Indigenous girl with her face dyed all black wearing a colourful feathered headband.

items.synopsis: In a 280,000-hectare triangle of preserved Amazon rainforest, Indigenous communities hope for "total eviction" of non-Indigenous settlers.

title.children: In an increasingly threatened rainforest, Indigenous teens carry out a rite of passage

image.altText: A green, glowing hospital cross sign outside a pharmacy

items.synopsis: Pharmacists in rural communities say they "won't be able to protect communities" against further medicine shortages from the 60-day prescription scheme as a new report claims huge losses for the industry.

title.children: Report warns huge job losses looming in pharmacy sector as a result of 60-day prescriptions

image.altText: Old man with grey hair and button up shirt

items.synopsis: The family of John Campbell Kerr releases a photograph of the 87-year-old in the hope it will encourage more witnesses to come forward to help with the investigation into his death at Noosa Heads on Sunday.

title.children: Family calls for witnesses after 87-year-old John Campbell Kerr's death at Noosa Heads

image.altText: A man and a woman walk on beach at sunrise. They are almost silhouetted by the sky behind them.

items.synopsis: Hosts of short-term accommodation platforms like Airbnb are shifting back to renting out their properties for longer terms as the rising cost of living dampens people's appetite for holidays.

title.children: 'Emotional decision': Property owners putting Airbnbs onto the rental market

image.altText: The ACT Supreme Court towards dusk.

items.synopsis: A 31-year-old man pleads guilty to choking two teenagers in retaliation for a slapping game gone wrong, in which he believed his stepson was hurt.

title.children: Canberra man pleads guilty to choking two 13-year-olds in retaliation for slapping game gone wrong

image.altText: Court hammer and judge in background

items.synopsis: Lies, threats and manipulation — how recordings exposed a rogue expert witness, in a case legal practitioners say is the tip of the iceberg.

title.children: Lies, threats and manipulation: The recordings exposing a court psychologist at work

image.altText: RBA governor Philip Lowe speaks at the Morgan Stanley Australia summit in Sydney

items.synopsis: Price caps on gas and energy bill subsidies may be lowering inflation. Can we do more things like that, instead of just raising interest rates?

title.children: Economists tell how to lower inflation without raising interest rates

image.altText: A view from above of water surrounding houses.

items.synopsis: The images taken from above the Kakhovka Dam show Russia had the means, motive and opportunity to bring down the structure.

title.children: Drone footage appears to show explosive-rigged car atop Ukrainian dam before collapse
